channel.title: solaranamnesis – Solar Anamnesis
channel.description: Scenes from the Solar System's Youth

item.title: NWA 980 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: Beautiful thin section of the NWA 980 Meteorite with a very interesting large fragment of seemingly different lithology. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 7859 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: The same thin section presented in the previous post is seen here in cross polarized light. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 7859 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: This visible light thin section gigapixel mosaic of the L3 NWA 7859 meteorite contains some highly unusual inclusions that appear to be characteristically grouped together. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: Clarendon (c) Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: The Clarendon (c) meteorite is a wonderful example of a named L4 chondrite with fusion crust. In the gigapixel image below one may see many diverse and distinct chondritic inclusions. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 6472 Meteorite Surface
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: With a classification of LL3.2, the NWA 6472 meteorite provides an abundance of fascinating chondrules. The colors are really amazing in cross polarized reflected light as seen in this surface focus stacked panorama taken with the Nikon Z6 attached to the LM scope adapter. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View […]
